{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child is presenting with fever, abdominal distension, vomiting, and pus cells in urine. These symptoms and findings suggest a possible urinary tract infection (UTI). The presence of pus cells in urine indicates an inflammatory response in the urinary tract. The high percentage of neutrophils in the WBC count further supports the possibility of infection. Therefore, the best line of management would be to send urine for culture and sensitivity to identify the causative organism and determine the appropriate antibiotic treatment. Starting IV antibiotics immediately would be the most appropriate choice to address the infection.", "answer_choice": "B"}
